result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Franklyn R Stapleman

records.addlTxt:
1:24 PM Defendant Franklyn R Stapleman in court.  Attorney Mark J Gumz in court for Franklyn R Stapleman.  Attorney Brian J. Juech in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz states his client will waive his right to preliminary hearing.  Court questions defendant.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds the waiver is being made freely, voluntarily & intelligently.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings. 
State has filed the Information.  Atty Gumz has received the information and waives it's reading.  Defendant stands mute.  Attorney Gumz requests the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Set for status.
Status hearing scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 01:15 pm.
Status hearing on January 3, 2023 at 01:15 pm.

1:23 PM Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Franklyn R Stapleman.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Gumz notes the zoom notice was for Judge Hendee.  Requests waiver of preliminary hearing date.
BY THE COURT:  Set.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on October 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on September 6, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status hearing on June 14, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

2:07 PM Defendant Franklyn R Stapleman appeared by video.  Attorney Mark J Gumz appeared by video for Franklyn R Stapleman.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Court notes that this will be assigned to a new Judge and will be set.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on May 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

02:16 PM Defendant Franklyn R Stapleman appeared by video means with Attorney Mark J Gumz. Prosecuting Atty Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video means for State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz was recently appointed on the case; requests a status date.  Atty Gumz states that since the defendant was in custody, booking has not been done yet.  Defendant was in custody for the last month in Waushara County.
  Court confirms address.

BY THE COURT:  Set status
Defendant is to be booked by 4:30pm tomorrow  Status hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Status hearing on April 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
*Appear for booking within 30 days to the Marquette County Jail  *No contact with Victim 1    **Bond to be signed and returned to the COC office within 14 days

10:17 AM Defendant Franklyn R Stapleman appeared by video means. Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.    Court confirms address.    Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and is going to get an Attorney, he is not eligible for a Public Defender.  

Court is going to proceed with the IA today.  
   Atty Juech has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $1,000 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking within 30 days to the Marquette County Jail
*No contact with Victim 1
  **Bond to be signed and returned to the COC office within 14 days

Court questions the defendant regarding time limits.  Defendant waives time limits.

BY THE COURT:    Defendant waives time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Status hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Initial appearance on February 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:36 AM Defendant Franklyn R Stapleman appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Clifford C. Burdon appeared for State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant had to call today to get the zoom info because he didn't get the criminal complaint.    Court confirms address and phone.  Defendant states that the address was the jail address.

BY THE COURT:  Reset so the complaint can be sent out.
  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
